snippet.textDisplay: It makes me sad because it never really stuck, Bomberman 64's gameplay and level design I mean. Even now it's pretty much gone entirely back to the square arena deathmatches, which is fine, but I personally enjoyed what Bomberman 64 gave us a lot.
snippet.textOriginal: It makes me sad because it never really stuck, Bomberman 64's gameplay and level design I mean. Even now it's pretty much gone entirely back to the square arena deathmatches, which is fine, but I personally enjoyed what Bomberman 64 gave us a lot.

snippet.textDisplay: The Bomberman series in general is underrated. The N64 games were my favorite. It pains me that this game got average and below average scores on most review sites...

snippet.textDisplay: i see.  i have a somewhat similar story with my mom, but she didn't grow distant.  instead, when i was second grade(?) she started teaching again, so that got iin the way of playing with her.  a real shame, too, because she was really good a platformers.  my sister and i are planning to reintroduce gaming to her though, via megaman2.  i hope that you're on better terms with your dad.
snippet.textOriginal: i see.  i have a somewhat similar story with my mom, but she didn't grow distant.  instead, when i was second grade(?) she started teaching again, so that got iin the way of playing with her.  a real shame, too, because she was really good a platformers.  my sister and i are planning to reintroduce gaming to her though, via megaman2.  i hope that you're on better terms with your dad.

snippet.textDisplay: One of the more under appreciated games on the N64. Me and friends used to rent this and go crazy with multiplayer. I managed to clear the one-player over time, but this game really shines with four controllers, and a group of people screaming and running from bombs.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the more under appreciated games on the N64. Me and friends used to rent this and go crazy with multiplayer. I managed to clear the one-player over time, but this game really shines with four controllers, and a group of people screaming and running from bombs.

snippet.textDisplay:
Me and my friend used to play this game so much when we were younger. We'd usaully play the pyramid map. I havn't played this game in a lnog time now, and I've forgot so much about it.

Nonetheless I remember that the game had some extraodinary music along with the sweet gameplay. It's simply games like this that makes you happy that you're a gamer, not to mention ALIVE.
snippet.textOriginal:
Me and my friend used to play this game so much when we were younger. We'd usaully play the pyramid map. I havn't played this game in a lnog time now, and I've forgot so much about it.

snippet.textDisplay: That's because he didn't! The first 64 game was composed by Akifumi Tada. Mitsuda did The Second Attack alongside Yoshitaka Hirota. Both are equally amazing soundtracks, and I consider 64 to be terribly underrated.
snippet.textOriginal: That's because he didn't! The first 64 game was composed by Akifumi Tada. Mitsuda did The Second Attack alongside Yoshitaka Hirota. Both are equally amazing soundtracks, and I consider 64 to be terribly underrated.
